programme.title: Seeking a Friend for the End of the World
Tražeći ljubav za kraj svijeta
programme.desc:
Seeking a Friend for the End of the World: Directed by Lorene Scafaria. With Steve Carell, Keira Knightley, Adam Brody, Connie Britton. As an asteroid nears Earth, a man finds himself alone after his wife leaves in a panic. He decides to take a road trip to reunite with his high school sweetheart. Accompanying him is a neighbor who inadvertently puts a wrench in his plan." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1307068/","name":"Seeking a Friend for the End of the World","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk4MDQ1NzE3N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMjA0MDkzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As an asteroid nears Earth, a man finds himself alone after his wife leaves in a panic. He decides to take a road trip to reunite with his high school sweetheart. Accompanying him is a neighbor who inadvertently puts a wrench in his ","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1307068/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"FrenchEddieFelson"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"A first movie as director? One thump up!","reviewBody":"Despite the imminent approach of an ineluctable end of the world, the film oddly bathes in a soft and serene atmosphere, if we obviously ignore some people who behave with humor, for our greatest pleasure: I mow my lawn, I do body-building, I am looking for a new Chief Financial Officer, I'm ready with my all-male friends to repopulate the planet (this one is undoubtedly my favorite), I collect vinyls in a digitized world (this one might be controversial), ... and tutti quanti!

Dodge (Steve Carell) and Penny (Keira Knightley) meet by chance while they are long-time neighbors. They will quickly realize that they perfectly match to achieve together their ultimate quests: he seeks to revisit the love of his life that he has not seen for 18 years and she seeks to see her parents and her nephew again. During these two concomitant quests, despite a 1-generation gap, they will learn to know each other, to appreciate each other, to desire each other.

As a synthesis: this movie is based on two marvelous characters characterized by their empathy and their beneficence, within an atmosphere as odd as wacky. 7/8 of 10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":111091,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Adventure","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2012-06-22","keywords":"end of the world,title directed by female,long title,road trip,human extinction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"No. 1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2149949721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcyNjU0NDYxNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTAzMjkzNw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcyNjU0NDYxNV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTAzMjkzNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"As an asteroid nears Earth, a man finds himself alone after his wife leaves in a panic. programme.title: Greenland
Greenland: Posljednje utočište
programme.desc: Greenland: Directed by Ric Roman Waugh. With Gerard Butler, Morena Baccarin, Roger Dale Floyd, Scott Glenn. A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7737786/","name":"Greenland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzcyMzU4MDUtM2JhOC00ZDg2LTg5MGMtZjc2OGMyMjhlMGE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7737786/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not what I was expecting, but it unexpectedly worked.","reviewBody":"If you're going into this expecting some high-stakes thrills and excitement with mind-blowing action and effect, you'll probably be disappointed, because that's what we've all become accustomed in these type of films. But in an unexpected and refreshing change, writer Chris Sparling made this story more about family dynamics and humanities quest for survival during an extinction-level disaster. This felt less Hollywood-ish, and more realistic than I expected, and that's a good thing. Director Ric Roman Waugh did a great job putting together Sparling's script. The 119 min runtime was just right, as was the pacing. The score was decent, but felt a little overbearing in some scenes. The casting was good, with Butler delivering as usual, but Morena Baccarin seemed bland in most of the film, and her constant side view during the car ride highlighting her terrible nose job was annoying. The score was decent, although overbearing in some scenes. I was disappointed with the 1990's CGI effects especially having a 35M budget. Nevertheless, a fun and enjoyable ride, and a solid 8/10 from me."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":100837,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-12-18","keywords":"natural disaster,looting,greenland,apocalypse,disaster film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2720317721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk1MzdlZTktMzc1Yi00YmQxLTgyMzctM2JkM2U4Mzc0OTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk1MzdlZTktMzc1Yi00YmQxLTgyMzctM2JkM2U4Mzc0OTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124930/","name":"Gerard Butler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1072555/","name":"Morena Baccarin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9819444/","name":"Roger Dale Floyd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006846/","name":"Ric Roman Waugh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0699213/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0413801/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2133655/","name":"Chris Sparling"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7737786/","name":"Greenland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzcyMzU4MDUtM2JhOC00ZDg2LTg5MGMtZjc2OGMyMjhlMGE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7737786/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic","dateCreated":"2020-12-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not what I was expecting, but it unexpectedly worked.","reviewBody":"If you're going into this expecting some high-stakes thrills and excitement with mind-blowing action and effect, you'll probably be disappointed, because that's what we've all become accustomed in these type of films. But in an unexpected and refreshing change, writer Chris Sparling made this story more about family dynamics and humanities quest for survival during an extinction-level disaster. This felt less Hollywood-ish, and more realistic than I expected, and that's a good thing. Director Ric Roman Waugh did a great job putting together Sparling's script. The 119 min runtime was just right, as was the pacing. The score was decent, but felt a little overbearing in some scenes. The casting was good, with Butler delivering as usual, but Morena Baccarin seemed bland in most of the film, and her constant side view during the car ride highlighting her terrible nose job was annoying. The score was decent, although overbearing in some scenes. I was disappointed with the 1990's CGI effects especially having a 35M budget. Nevertheless, a fun and enjoyable ride, and a solid 8/10 from me.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":100837,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-12-18","keywords":"natural disaster,looting,greenland,apocalypse,disaster film","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2720317721","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk1MzdlZTktMzc1Yi00YmQxLTgyMzctM2JkM2U4Mzc0OTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk1MzdlZTktMzc1Yi00YmQxLTgyMzctM2JkM2U4Mzc0OTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124930/","name":"Gerard Butler","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1072555/","name":"Morena Baccarin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9819444/","name":"Roger Dale Floyd"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006846/","name":"Ric Roman Waugh"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0699213/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0413801/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172670/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2133655/","name":"Chris Sparling"],"duration":"PT1H59M"</script><metacontent="

An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3502248/","name":"Bosch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBiYjg4OTgtZDg2YS00ZGIzLTk3ZWMtZWRlZDQ5M2I0MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3502248/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"meckstut"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great to Have Season 7","reviewBody":"Have been looking forward to Season 7 after Covid-binging on the first 6 seasons late last year. Does not disappoint, love Harry of course but the continuing development of the supporting characters and the side stories is what makes this such an interesting watch.\n\nCharacter development and casting is excellent with one exception -- "Maddy". I really dislike the character and the actor. Is she someone's daughter and was put into the cast as a favor? The writers must not like her either because they give really bad lines (so out of character for the rest of the series). How many times is she going to say "Dad, you are scaring me"? And, with the semi-serious, worried look. Dopey! Bad writing, bad acting.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-02-06","keywords":"father daughter relationship,homicide detective,police procedural,police detective,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920038/","name":"Titus Welliver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373100/","name":"Jamie Hector"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0032628/","name":"Amy Aquino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0483993/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420833/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0653899/","name":"Eric Ellis Overmyer"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch the Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3258368025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU4MWFhMWYtMjdmNi00ZDNkLWI4NWMtNWJiNjBlYjFkMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU4MWFhMWYtMjdmNi00ZDNkLWI4NWMtNWJiNjBlYjFkMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zero Days
Zero Days
programme.desc: Zero Days: Directed by Alex Gibney. With Sergey Ulasen, Eric Chien, Eugene Kaspersky, Vitaly Kamluk. A documentary focused on Stuxnet, a piece of self-replicating computer malware that the U.S. and Israel unleashed to destroy a key part of an Iranian nuclear facility, and which ultimately spread beyond its intended target." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5446858/","name":"Zero Days","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUyODE1NTIzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMjA5NjY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A documentary focused on Stuxnet, a piece of self-replicating computer malware that the U.S. and Israel unleashed to destroy a key part of an Iranian nuclear facility, and which ultimately spread beyond its intended target.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5446858/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"nobrun"},"dateCreated":"2017-02-03","inLanguage":"English","name":"A must-watch","reviewBody":"Great documentary. Very informative and enlightening (not for the Pixar crowd). Very honest and surprisingly propaganda-free. The film maker went to great lengths to find credible, knowledgeable and highly qualified people to interview for this topic. Kudos.\n\n"To make a documentary on such a complicated, far-reaching subject and maintain a common-sense perspective requires formidable organizational skills and a steady narrative hand to keep the movie from straying into any number of theoretical byways. It takes the imagination of a science- fiction writer to make it coherent and entertaining enough to hold your attention. Mr. Gibney has demonstrated all of these qualities..." Stephen Holden, The New York Times.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":9445,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.8},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Documentary"],"datePublished":"2016-07-08","keywords":"iran,cyber attack,computer worm,hacking,stuxnet","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3677533209","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1OTg2MDExMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI5ODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTc1OTg2MDExMF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTI5ODY5ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"a documentary thriller about the world of cyberwar. For the first time, the film tells the complete story of Stuxnet, a piece of self-replicating computer malware (known as a "worm" for its ability to burrow from computer to computer on its own) that the U.S. and Israel unleashed to destroy a key part of an Iranian nuclear facility, and which ultimately spread beyond its intended target."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2172320/","name":"David Sanger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8256133/","name":"Emad Kiyaei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5917506/","name":"Eric Chien"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316795/","name":"Alex Gibney"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336679/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133364/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316795/","name":"Alex Gibney"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Big Wedding
Vjenčanje godine
programme.desc: The Big Wedding: Directed by Justin Zackham. With Robert De Niro, Katherine Heigl, Diane Keaton, Amanda Seyfried. A long-divorced couple fakes being married as their family unites for a wedding." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1931435/","name":"The Big Wedding","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTcwODUwMjg2Ml5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMTc2NzkxOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A long-divorced couple fakes being married as their family unites for a wedding.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1931435/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"crossroadsxdemon"},"dateCreated":"2013-04-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Awkward with a capital A","reviewBody":"Over all the movie was a bit of a disappointment even though I've been looking forward to seeing it for quite some time (Not for the big A- list case either), Rather I was looking forward to seeing the Talents of Ben Barnes back on the big screen. I wasn't disappointed in that regard. His portrayal of Alejandro was brilliant, his American accent was exact and his Spanish was impressive as well. I thought Al and Missy were adorable, but the movie itself had way too much going on. Just when you thought the story line couldn't get any crazier something stupider happened and by the end it was hard to keep everything that was going on straight. It had endearing and sweet family moments that were really it's only saving grace. If you had cut out half the random story lines and the random awkward sexual parts that...for the record did not add to the plot line, it would have been a great movie but as usual a potentially good film is ruined with crude comedy. That being said some of the story lines that had been supplemented by crude comedy were amusing story lines but were sort of ruined.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":48573,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.6},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2013-04-26","keywords":"wedding,divorce,family relationships,farce,adoption","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Version 2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2079761945","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExNDc2Mzk1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDk0MzEzOQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjExNDc2Mzk1N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwMDk0MzEzOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"To the amusement of their adult children and friends, long divorced couple Don and Ellie Griffin are once again forced to play the happy couple for the sake of their adopted son's wedding after his ultra conservative biological mother unexpectedly decides to fly halfway across the world to attend. With all of the wedding guests looking on, the Griffins are hilariously forced to confront their past, present and future - and hopefully avoid killing each other in the process. "},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000134/","name":"Robert De Niro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001337/","name":"Katherine Heigl"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951698/","name":"Justin Zackham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0188112/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0002572/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0951698/","name":"Justin Zackham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0111379/","name":"Jean-Stéphane Bron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0837141/","name":"Karine Sudan"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Gospodin Link: U potrazi za skrivenim gradom
Greenland
Greenland: Posljednje utočište
programme.desc: Greenland: Directed by Ric Roman Waugh. With Gerard Butler, Morena Baccarin, Roger Dale Floyd, Scott Glenn. A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt7737786/","name":"Greenland","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzcyMzU4MDUtM2JhOC00ZDg2LTg5MGMtZjc2OGMyMjhlMGE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt7737786/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Top_Dawg_Critic"},"dateCreated":"2020-12-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not what I was expecting, but it unexpectedly worked.","reviewBody":"If you're going into this expecting some high-stakes thrills and excitement with mind-blowing action and effect, you'll probably be disappointed, because that's what we've all become accustomed in these type of films. But in an unexpected and refreshing change, writer Chris Sparling made this story more about family dynamics and humanities quest for survival during an extinction-level disaster. This felt less Hollywood-ish, and more realistic than I expected, and that's a good thing. Director Ric Roman Waugh did a great job putting together Sparling's script. The 119 min runtime was just right, as was the pacing. The score was decent, but felt a little overbearing in some scenes. The casting was good, with Butler delivering as usual, but Morena Baccarin seemed bland in most of the film, and her constant side view during the car ride highlighting her terrible nose job was annoying. The score was decent, although overbearing in some scenes. I was disappointed with the 1990's CGI effects especially having a 35M budget. Nevertheless, a fun and enjoyable ride, and a solid 8/10 from me."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":100837,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2020-12-18","keywords":"natural disaster,looting,greenland,apocalypse,disaster film","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2720317721","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk1MzdlZTktMzc1Yi00YmQxLTgyMzctM2JkM2U4Mzc0OTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk1MzdlZTktMzc1Yi00YmQxLTgyMzctM2JkM2U4Mzc0OTFjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXZ3ZXNsZXk@._V1_.jpg","description":"A family struggles for survival in the face of a cataclysmic natural disaster."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124930/","name":"Gerard Butler"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1072555/","name":"Morena Baccarin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9819444/","name":"Roger Dale Floyd"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0006846/","name":"Ric Roman Waugh"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0699213/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0413801/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0172670/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2133655/","name":"Chris Sparling"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

For the first time, the film tells the complete story of Stuxnet, a piece of self-replicating computer malware (known as a "worm" for its ability to burrow from computer to computer on its own) that the U.S. and Israel unleashed to destroy a key part of an Iranian nuclear facility, and which ultimately spread beyond its intended target."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2172320/","name":"David Sanger"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm8256133/","name":"Emad Kiyaei"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5917506/","name":"Eric Chien"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316795/","name":"Alex Gibney"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0336679/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0133364/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0132772/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0316795/","name":"Alex Gibney"}],"duration":"PT1H56M"}</script><metacontent="

Very informative and enlightening (not for the Pixar crowd). Very honest and surprisingly propaganda-free. The film maker went to great lengths to find credible, knowledgeable and highly qualified people to interview for this topic. Kudos.\n\n"To make a documentary on such a complicated, far-reaching subject and maintain a common-sense perspective requires formidable organizational skills and a steady narrative hand to keep the movie from straying into any number of theoretical byways. programme.title: Teen Spirit
Teen Spirit
programme.desc: Teen Spirit: Directed by Max Minghella. With Elle Fanning, Agnieszka Grochowska, Archie Madekwe, Zlatko Buric. Violet is a shy teenager who dreams of escaping her small town and pursuing her passion to sing. With the help of an unlikely mentor, she enters a local singing competition that will test her integrity, talent and ambition. Driven by a pop-fueled soundtrack, Teen Spirit is a visceral and stylish spin on the Cinderella story." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6483364/","name":"Teen Spirit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjk0MmFmMDAtNDY0YS00MTk2LTkwMGItYWQ5M2U4MzM0ZWM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDY2MjcyOTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violet is a shy teenager who dreams of escaping her small town and pursuing her passion to sing. Driven by","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6483364/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"MR_Heraclius"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Good!!","reviewBody":"Teen Spirit is a very well made musical drama. Elle Fanning delivers an excellent lead performance. She shines throughout this film. The supporting cast also does a good job in this film. The film is very well directed by first timer Max Minghella. The film is very stylish, and makes good use of its pop soundtrack. You are never bored during its runtime, even when you know where this film is going. Easily the film's main weaknesses is its storyline. You know where the film is going right from the start. But it's so well done that you can forgive it. Overall, this isn't anything really new, but it's well made enough to keep you entertained.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":8378,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Drama","Music"],"datePublished":"2019-04-19","keywords":"singer,singing,bar singer,bar,horse","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3412245017","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTUzYTJmNTItZGQ1Yi00Y2E0LWJkMDAtNDkwMjU2NDQ1MGY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTUzYTJmNTItZGQ1Yi00Y2E0LWJkMDAtNDkwMjU2NDQ1MGY1XkEyXkFqcGdeQW1yb3NzZXI@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violet (Elle Fanning) dreams of pop stardom to escape her small town and shattered family life. programme.desc: Bosch: Created by Eric Ellis Overmyer. With Titus Welliver, Jamie Hector, Amy Aquino, Lance Reddick. An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt3502248/","name":"Bosch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDBiYjg4OTgtZDg2YS00ZGIzLTk3ZWMtZWRlZDQ5M2I0MDNhXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"An L.A.P.D. homicide detective works to solve the murder of a thirteen-year-old boy while standing trial in federal court for the murder of a serial killer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3502248/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"meckstut"},"dateCreated":"2021-06-27","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great to Have Season 7","reviewBody":"Have been looking forward to Season 7 after Covid-binging on the first 6 seasons late last year. Does not disappoint, love Harry of course but the continuing development of the supporting characters and the side stories is what makes this such an interesting watch.\n\nCharacter development and casting is excellent with one exception -- "Maddy". I really dislike the character and the actor. Is she someone's daughter and was put into the cast as a favor? The writers must not like her either because they give really bad lines (so out of character for the rest of the series). How many times is she going to say "Dad, you are scaring me"? And, with the semi-serious, worried look. Dopey! Bad writing, bad acting.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":59507,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.4},"contentRating":"TV-MA","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2014-02-06","keywords":"father daughter relationship,homicide detective,police procedural,police detective,based on novel","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0920038/","name":"Titus Welliver"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0373100/","name":"Jamie Hector"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0032628/","name":"Amy Aquino"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0483993/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0420833/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319272/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0653899/","name":"Eric Ellis Overmyer"}],"trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Watch the Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3258368025","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU4MWFhMWYtMjdmNi00ZDNkLWI4NWMtNWJiNjBlYjFkMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNGU4MWFhMWYtMjdmNi00ZDNkLWI4NWMtNWJiNjBlYjFkMmU3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""}}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Dheepan
Dheepan
programme.desc:
Dheepan: Directed by Jacques Audiard. With Jesuthasan Antonythasan, Kalieaswari Srinivasan, Claudine Vinasithamby, Vincent Rottiers. Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4082068/","name":"Dheepan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzc1NzgwMzgyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzAwMzQ1ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4082068/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"HollywoodGlee"},"dateCreated":"2015-11-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"The story of a displaced Sri Lankan Tamil Tiger","reviewBody":"Reviewed by Larry Gleeson. Viewed during 2015 AFI FEST.

"Dheepan," is the latest work by director Jacques Audiard. Audiard has to his credits the critically acclaimed and well nominated films "Rust and Bone"(2012), and "A Prophet"(2009). "Dheepan," is written by Audiard, Thomas Bidegain and Noe Debre', and tells the story of a Sri Lankan Tamil Tiger, called Dheepan. Dheepan is played by Indian actor, Antonythasan Jesuthasan.

Winner of the coveted Palm d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival, "Deephan," is a visual feast beginning in the jungles of Sri Lanka and the ensuing shots depicting Dheepan's cultural transformation in the night streets of Paris. Epinine Momenceau provides the cinematography in a compelling manner along with a nicely done soundtrack by Nicolas Jarr.

As the film opens we see Dheepan and fellow Tamil warriors placing dry palm branches over a funeral pyre. Dheepan place his military fatigues on top and lights the fire. Sri Lanka is mired in a bloody civil war. Dheepan along with an unknown woman called Yalini, played by Kalieaswari Srinivasan, and a young orphan girl, Illayaal, played by Claudine Vinasithamby, decide to flee the strife together and set out for a new life in the suburbs of Paris posing as a displaced refugee family. With the inventiveness of a well versed interpreter, Dheepan and Yalini pass their social services interview and find employment as caretakers of a not so well-to-do housing project and one of it's incoherent inhabitants.To complicate matters, Illayaal is having difficulties at school, Dheepan is contacted by a Tamil warrior who insists Dheepan continue the fight for freedom, and Yalini is becoming attracted to the gang leader nephew of her incoherent charge. This is all on top of the deeper humanistic component of three strangers living together as a family in a small apartment in an entirely foreign culture.

Soon, however, Dheepan and his refugee family begin to pull together as they experience renewed forms of violence. Their challenging suburban life becomes increasingly dangerous due to drug activity and an ensuing turf war that hits too close to home. Dheepan, working primarily as an janitor, takes a stand and declares a no-fire zone between his apartment building and the adjacent housing project much to the disbelief and chagrin of the well-armed gang members. As the turf war breaks out and spills over into the "safe zone," Dheepan shifts gears and his switch is flipped. He becomes an uber-soldier defending and protecting what has become his. This is an extraordinary transformation as he resorts to survival skills presumably developed as a Tamil freedom fighter. The action sequences heightens the drama in its fragmented and rather hazy segments as Dheepan's deep and powerful emotional chords propel him through the violence and chaos until victory is his.

All in all, I found "Dheepan," to be a very moving film with its riveting action sequences contrasting with its earlier tender, more human sequences. Audiard takes a very timely topic, the displaced refugee, and embodies him and her, with very human characteristics. IMDb data; ttnr: 4082068, Title: Dheepan, --- Description: Dheepan: Directed by Jacques Audiard. With Jesuthasan Antonythasan, Kalieaswari Srinivasan, Claudine Vinasithamby, Vincent Rottiers. Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4082068/","name":"Dheepan","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzc1NzgwMzgyM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzAwMzQ1ODE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Dheepan is a Sri Lankan Tamil warrior who flees to France and ends up working as a caretaker outside Paris.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4082068/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"HollywoodGlee","dateCreated":"2015-11-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"The story of a displaced Sri Lankan Tamil Tiger","reviewBody":"Reviewed by Larry Gleeson. Viewed during 2015 AFI FEST.

"Dheepan," is the latest work by director Jacques Audiard. Audiard has to his credits the critically acclaimed and well nominated films "Rust and Bone"(2012), and "A Prophet"(2009). "Dheepan," is written by Audiard, Thomas Bidegain and Noe Debre', and tells the story of a Sri Lankan Tamil Tiger, called Dheepan. Dheepan is played by Indian actor, Antonythasan Jesuthasan.

Winner of the coveted Palm d'Or at the Cannes Film Festival, "Deephan," is a visual feast beginning in the jungles of Sri Lanka and the ensuing shots depicting Dheepan's cultural transformation in the night streets of Paris. Epinine Momenceau provides the cinematography in a compelling manner along with a nicely done soundtrack by Nicolas Jarr.

As the film opens we see Dheepan and fellow Tamil warriors placing dry palm branches over a funeral pyre. Dheepan place his military fatigues on top and lights the fire. Sri Lanka is mired in a bloody civil war. Dheepan along with an unknown woman called Yalini, played by Kalieaswari Srinivasan, and a young orphan girl, Illayaal, played by Claudine Vinasithamby, decide to flee the strife together and set out for a new life in the suburbs of Paris posing as a displaced refugee family. With the inventiveness of a well versed interpreter, Dheepan and Yalini pass their social services interview and find employment as caretakers of a not so well-to-do housing project and one of it's incoherent inhabitants.To complicate matters, Illayaal is having difficulties at school, Dheepan is contacted by a Tamil warrior who insists Dheepan continue the fight for freedom, and Yalini is becoming attracted to the gang leader nephew of her incoherent charge. This is all on top of the deeper humanistic component of three strangers living together as a family in a small apartment in an entirely foreign culture.

Soon, however, Dheepan and his refugee family begin to pull together as they experience renewed forms of violence. Their challenging suburban life becomes increasingly dangerous due to drug activity and an ensuing turf war that hits too close to home. Dheepan, working primarily as an janitor, takes a stand and declares a no-fire zone between his apartment building and the adjacent housing project much to the disbelief and chagrin of the well-armed gang members. As the turf war breaks out and spills over into the "safe zone," Dheepan shifts gears and his switch is flipped. He becomes an uber-soldier defending and protecting what has become his. This is an extraordinary transformation as he resorts to survival skills presumably developed as a Tamil freedom fighter. The action sequences heightens the drama in its fragmented and rather hazy segments as Dheepan's deep and powerful emotional chords propel him through the violence and chaos until victory is his.

All in all, I found "Dheepan," to be a very moving film with its riveting action sequences contrasting with its earlier tender, more human sequences. Audiard takes a very timely topic, the displaced refugee, and embodies him and her, with very human characteristics. Highly Recommended.","aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":15328,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.2,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-08-26","keywords":"tamil,caretaker,france,sri lankan,janitor","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bande-annonce [OV]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2043853337","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjNkZjFkNjEtZWE2Ni00YTI2LWJmNjktYWRjZmIwNTA2MDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjNkZjFkNjEtZWE2Ni00YTI2LWJmNjktYWRjZmIwNTA2MDM4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7316147/","name":"Jesuthasan Antonythasan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7316148/","name":"Kalieaswari Srinivasan","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7316149/","name":"Claudine Vinasithamby"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002191/","name":"Jacques Audiard"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0049689/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0258767/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0056755/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0002191/","name":"Jacques Audiard","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0081179/","name":"Thomas Bidegain","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4380548/","name":"Noé Debré"],"duration":"PT1H55M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Laku noć
programme.desc: Jednog sunčanog dana u Gani stranac pristupi dječaku i djevojčici te ih odvede na neočekivano putovanje. Njih troje tako se dobro slažu da "Bogah", stranac, počne preispitivati svoje početne namjere. Stranac u Gani dobije zadatak od svoje bande da pronađe djecu za jedan rizičan posao koji bi se trebao obaviti kasnije te večeri. Dok provodi dan s dvoje energične djece, Princeom i Matildom, počne sumnjati u svoju odluku te kako će ona utjecati na njihove živote.

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Vječni sjaj nepobjedivog uma
programme.desc:
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind: Directed by Michel Gondry. With Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Gerry Robert Byrne, Elijah Wood. When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338013/","name":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NzcwODg3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTEwOTMyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338013/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rje58"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great, if you can relate...","reviewBody":"If you can relate to the underlying theme of love longed for, love given and received, and love lost, this is a great film. If you have come to understand that acceptance can -sometimes- be a great thing and not a compromise or a 'settle for' - this is a moving film.

As crazy and almost surreal as elements of this film are, it somehow remains honest and real. That seems like a contradiction... life is contradictory, isn't it?

Carrey and Winslet both turn in superb performances, as do the supporting cast. An incredible film that most of the people who 'get it' will love - but I suspect there will be more than a small percentage who won't understand it or can't relate to it and they will (understandably) dislike it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":952534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2004-03-19","keywords":"memory,loneliness,valentine's day,flashback,nonlinear timeline","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2292515097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4YjQ5ZjEtMGQ4Mi00NWExLTkxMGQtNzAwYzVmNTU1ODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4YjQ5ZjEtMGQ4Mi00NWExLTkxMGQtNzAwYzVmNTU1ODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327273/","name":"Michel Gondry"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017713/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0442109/","name":"Charlie Kaufman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327273/","name":"Michel Gondry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1410028/","name":"Pierre Bismuth"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Di jiu tianchang
Zbogom, sine
programme.desc:
Di jiu tianchang: Directed by Xiaoshuai Wang. With Jingchun Wang, Mei Yong, Xi Qi, Roy Wang. Two married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9581076/","name":"Di jiu tianchang","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDQ2OTcwYTQtYmViZS00MjkzLWIwNTAtODUwMmJkYjZhMDE0XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzI1NzMxNzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two married couples adjust to the vast social and economic changes taking place in China from the 1980s to the present.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9581076/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"liuruiorp"},"dateCreated":"2019-12-01","inLanguage":"English","name":"A dreamy observation of a changing nation","reviewBody":"In very many ways this film is almost a reboot of Zhang Yimou's film To Live, from 1994, which tells the many trials and tribulations of a family from the founding of the People's Republic in 1949 to the end of the Cultural Revolution in 1976. So Long My Son picks up that chronological baton, and tells a story about family bonds, the meaning of friendship and what constitutes our morals and ethics through the last 30/40 years of Chinese history, from a stilted, materially basic time of 1980 through to the hypermodernity of China in the 2010s.

In the same way To Live aimed thinly disguised critiques at the Chinese government's policies through showing its impact on ordinary people, So Long My Son fires a number of shots too and it's in fact a little surprising to me some of these have been overlooked by the censors. The most obvious of them is the criticism of the one child policy, but hidden in there too are mentions of the privatisation of state owned industries in the early 90s and the mass redundancies that went with them, as well as criticism of the wealth inequality of modern China that has ensued from the market economy transition of the 80s and 90s.

I'm unsure if this was a problem specific to the release version I saw, though I have seen other reviews saying the plot was hard to follow, but I noticed that the English subtitles was often only translating about 1/5 of the dialogue in Mandarin. As a speaker of both, I followed the plot and characters quite easily, but can absolutely understand why many reviewers and comments have said they found the characters and plots hard to distinguish if the subtitling was a problem. However, with one eye on the subtitles, I think the fact they were missing a lot of the Mandarin dialogue would have created a really dreamy plotline that complements well the cinematographic style deployed - long panoramic shots that suddenly cut into a character's perspective; languid sequences that soak in the environment; and shots designed to make the audience feel voyeurs in a private situation.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3740,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"china,non linear,nonlinear timeline,hospital,loss of son","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1042071321","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4592524/","name":"Jingchun Wang"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3619308/","name":"Mei Yong"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5035471/","name":"Xi Qi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0514744/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4461717/","name":"Mei Ah"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"}],"duration":"PT3H5M"}</script><metacontent="

I'm unsure if this was a problem specific to the release version I saw, though I have seen other reviews saying the plot was hard to follow, but I noticed that the English subtitles was often only translating about 1/5 of the dialogue in Mandarin. As a speaker of both, I followed the plot and characters quite easily, but can absolutely understand why many reviewers and comments have said they found the characters and plots hard to distinguish if the subtitling was a problem. However, with one eye on the subtitles, I think the fact they were missing a lot of the Mandarin dialogue would have created a really dreamy plotline that complements well the cinematographic style deployed - long panoramic shots that suddenly cut into a character's perspective; languid sequences that soak in the environment; and shots designed to make the audience feel voyeurs in a private situation.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3740,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"genre":["Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-03-22","keywords":"china,non linear,nonlinear timeline,hospital,loss of son","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [OVS]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1042071321","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThlNmFjNjAtNjkwZS00NTU1LWJkM2ItZGIyNmVlZDRmMGM5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4592524/","name":"Jingchun Wang","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3619308/","name":"Mei Yong","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5035471/","name":"Xi Qi"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0514744/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4461717/","name":"Mei Ah","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0911075/","name":"Xiaoshuai Wang"],"duration":"PT3H5M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind
Vječni sjaj nepobjedivog uma
programme.desc:
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind: Directed by Michel Gondry. With Jim Carrey, Kate Winslet, Gerry Robert Byrne, Elijah Wood. When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0338013/","name":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY4NzcwODg3Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNTEwOTMyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"When their relationship turns sour, a couple undergoes a medical procedure to have each other erased from their memories.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0338013/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"rje58"},"dateCreated":"2004-03-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Great, if you can relate...","reviewBody":"If you can relate to the underlying theme of love longed for, love given and received, and love lost, this is a great film. If you have come to understand that acceptance can -sometimes- be a great thing and not a compromise or a 'settle for' - this is a moving film.

As crazy and almost surreal as elements of this film are, it somehow remains honest and real. That seems like a contradiction... life is contradictory, isn't it?

Carrey and Winslet both turn in superb performances, as do the supporting cast. An incredible film that most of the people who 'get it' will love - but I suspect there will be more than a small percentage who won't understand it or can't relate to it and they will (understandably) dislike it."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":952534,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2004-03-19","keywords":"memory,loneliness,valentine's day,flashback,nonlinear timeline","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2292515097","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4YjQ5ZjEtMGQ4Mi00NWExLTkxMGQtNzAwYzVmNTU1ODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTA4YjQ5ZjEtMGQ4Mi00NWExLTkxMGQtNzAwYzVmNTU1ODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000120/","name":"Jim Carrey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000701/","name":"Kate Winslet"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0929489/","name":"Tom Wilkinson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327273/","name":"Michel Gondry"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042399/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017525/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017713/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0442109/","name":"Charlie Kaufman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0327273/","name":"Michel Gondry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1410028/","name":"Pierre Bismuth"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zulu
Zulu
programme.desc:
Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"juho69"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cymru Am Byth in South Africa","reviewBody":"If you watch only the first two minutes of 'Zulu', it will be worth your while. The superbly dramatic theme music, followed immediately by Richard Burton's striking Welsh narration, are utterly entrancing. The rest of the film is not bad, either!

In January 1879, during the Boer War, at Isandhlwana in South Africa, over one thousand British troops are annihilated by King Cetshwayo's Zulu army. Standing between the four thousand Zulus and victory is the mission station at Rorke's Drift and about one hundred and forty British soldiers, some of whom are wounded. Commanding the military operation is the young Lieutenant John Chard (Stanley Baker, also co-producer of the film) with Lieutenant Gonville Bromhead (Michael Caine, in his first major film role). Against the unimaginable odds, the British troops - the B Company of the 24th Regiment of Foot, South Wales Borderers - manage, with exceptional courage and stoicism, to hold off the Zulu attacks until morning. The valour of the men defending Rourke's Drift resulted in the awarding of eleven Victoria Crosses. The roll of honour is recited by Richard Burton at the film's end.

Baker and Caine are very convincing in the two lead roles as Chard and Bromhead, the rival lieutenants from different social classes who come to respect and even like each other. Their first meeting emphasises the psychological as well as the physical distance between them. Chard, the Engineer Officer, in his shirt-sleeves, is up to his waist in water; Bromhead, the upper-class blue-blood, in his helmet and fine cloak, is on horseback, having just returned from hunting. However, as the battle progresses, this rivalry is forgotten as their prime concern is the job in hand. Their exchange when Chard is injured and Bromhead goes to his aid is telling. By the end of the film, as they stand together in the burnt-out ruins of the hospital, they are equals.

The incredibly virile Stanley Baker (one wants to say, "Fwhoar!" every time he appears on screen) co-produced the film because, like most Welshmen, he was extremely patriotic and wanted to publicise the bravery of the Welsh soldiers at Rorke's Drift. Michael Caine auditioned originally for the part of Hook but was offered instead the part of Bromhead as his looks were considered more suited to those of an upper-class officer than a Cockney private.

Good support is given by the other actors in the supporting roles. James Booth as Private Henry Hook is probably the most memorable character, portrayed (historically inaccurately) as the company ne'er-do-well, yet who wakes up to his duty at the moment of crisis and fights almost to the death. Jack Hawkins and Ulla Jacobssen are effective as the well-meaning but naive father-and-daughter missionaries, the Witts. The outstanding bravery and selflessness of the other (mainly) Welsh soldiers is brought out by all the actors in the subordinate roles. 

What I think is very admirable about 'Zulu' is its lack of jingoism. Far from it crowing about British supremacy over the natives, it portrays the bravery of the Zulus as equal to or even greater than that of the British. At the end of the battle, there is no great rejoicing; it was just a job which had to be done because they were there. In the ruins of the hospital, when Chard asks Bromhead how he feels, Bromhead replies, "Sick." Their dialogue continues: 

Bromhead: There's something else. I feel ashamed. Was that how it was for you? The first time?

Chard: First time? Do you think I could stand this butcher's yard more than once?

Bromhead: I didn't know. 

Chard: I told you. I came up here to build a bridge.

No more needs to be said.

Although the character names and events are factual, the film does sometimes sacrifice historical accuracy for dramatic effect. How much real rivalry there was between Chard and Bromhead is unclear - although it is true that Bromhead ceded command to Chard. Private Hook was not the thief and ne'er-do-well as played by James Booth. Colour Sergeant Bourne was a short man and quite unlike Nigel Green in appearance. Most of the Victoria Cross winners were English, not Welsh. And the film itself was shot not at Rorke's Drift but at a location some miles away.

Interestingly, neither Chard nor Bromhead lived to a great age. Both died in their forties, Chard of mouth cancer in 1897 and Bromhead of fever on active service a few years before. Neither ever married. Nevertheless, their names are immortalised in 'Zulu' - as are the deeds of the tremendously brave men, Welsh, English and Zulu, at Rorke's Drift on 22nd/23rd January 1879.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

The superbly dramatic theme music, followed immediately by Richard Burton's striking Welsh narration, are utterly entrancing. The rest of the film is not bad, either!

In January 1879, during the Boer War, at Isandhlwana in South Africa, over one thousand British troops are annihilated by King Cetshwayo's Zulu army. Standing between the four thousand Zulus and victory is the mission station at Rorke's Drift and about one hundred and forty British soldiers, some of whom are wounded. Commanding the military operation is the young Lieutenant John Chard (Stanley Baker, also co-producer of the film) with Lieutenant Gonville Bromhead (Michael Caine, in his first major film role). Against the unimaginable odds, the British troops - the B Company of the 24th Regiment of Foot, South Wales Borderers - manage, with exceptional courage and stoicism, to hold off the Zulu attacks until morning. By the end of the film, as they stand together in the burnt-out ruins of the hospital, they are equals.

Michael Caine auditioned originally for the part of Hook but was offered instead the part of Bromhead as his looks were considered more suited to those of an upper-class officer than a Cockney private.

Good support is given by the other actors in the supporting roles. James Booth as Private Henry Hook is probably the most memorable character, portrayed (historically inaccurately) as the company ne'er-do-well, yet who wakes up to his duty at the moment of crisis and fights almost to the death. Jack Hawkins and Ulla Jacobssen are effective as the well-meaning but naive father-and-daughter missionaries, the Witts. The outstanding bravery and selflessness of the other (mainly) Welsh soldiers is brought out by all the actors in the subordinate roles. 

What I think is very admirable about 'Zulu' is its lack of jingoism. Far from it crowing about British supremacy over the natives, it portrays the bravery of the Zulus as equal to or even greater than that of the British. At the end of the battle, there is no great rejoicing; it was just a job which had to be done because they were there. In the ruins of the hospital, when Chard asks Bromhead how he feels, Bromhead replies, "Sick." Their dialogue continues: 

Bromhead: There's something else. I feel ashamed. Was that how it was for you? The first time?

Chard: First time? Do you think I could stand this butcher's yard more than once?

Bromhead: I didn't know. 

Chard: I told you. I came up here to build a bridge.

No more needs to be said.

How much real rivalry there was between Chard and Bromhead is unclear - although it is true that Bromhead ceded command to Chard. Private Hook was not the thief and ne'er-do-well as played by James Booth. Colour Sergeant Bourne was a short man and quite unlike Nigel Green in appearance. Most of the Victoria Cross winners were English, not Welsh. And the film itself was shot not at Rorke's Drift but at a location some miles away.

Interestingly, neither Chard nor Bromhead lived to a great age. Both died in their forties, Chard of mouth cancer in 1897 and Bromhead of fever on active service a few years before. Neither ever married. Nevertheless, their names are immortalised in 'Zulu' - as are the deeds of the tremendously brave men, Welsh, English and Zulu, at Rorke's Drift on 22nd/23rd January 1879.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"],"duration":"PT2H18M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Phoenix, Oregon
Phoenix, Oregon
programme.desc: Phoenix, Oregon: Directed by Gary Lundgren. With James Le Gros, Jesse Borrego, Lisa Edelstein, Diedrich Bader. Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8586088/","name":"Phoenix, Oregon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlhMGRlYzctNWYzOC00NmE3LWE3MWQtNDk4NmNiODUwMTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQxOTU3NjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8586088/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LilyWai"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Genuine","reviewBody":"Loved this film, a little sweet snapshot of how droll the midlife grind can be when you don't have the life you thought you'd have. Great understated performance from James LeGros as Bobby, and the full cast of his friends & associates offer plenty of dramatic layers for his character to engage with. Jesse Borego as Carlos is a breath of fresh air to Bobby's downer moments & his passion for his craft is infectious. I appreciated the fumbled semi romantic thread between Bobby and Tanya too as too often in movies it's all packaged up so neatly the viewer is deprived of seeing the truth when it comes to 'just not the right time' connections. Oh and have to mention Kevin Corrigan's Al, nicely positioned in both character and storyline as Bobby's polar opposite nemesis. Highly recommend but one negative is I almost passed this by thanks to the insipid title. I get the 'Phoenix' connection in the storyline but come on, something a little more thoughtful would be cherry on the top.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":338,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-03-20","keywords":"battle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3567762969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001457/","name":"James Le Gros"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001963/","name":"Jesse Borrego"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249046/","name":"Lisa Edelstein"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0324375/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Zulu
Zulu
programme.desc:
Zulu: Directed by Cy Endfield. With Stanley Baker, Jack Hawkins, Ulla Jacobsson, James Booth. Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0058777/","name":"Zulu","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYzdlYmQ3MWMtMDY3My00MzVmLTg0YmMtYjRlZDUzNjBlMmE0L2ltYWdlL2ltYWdlXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc1NTYyMjg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0058777/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"juho69"},"dateCreated":"2004-12-30","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cymru Am Byth in South Africa","reviewBody":"If you watch only the first two minutes of 'Zulu', it will be worth your while. The superbly dramatic theme music, followed immediately by Richard Burton's striking Welsh narration, are utterly entrancing. The rest of the film is not bad, either!

In January 1879, during the Boer War, at Isandhlwana in South Africa, over one thousand British troops are annihilated by King Cetshwayo's Zulu army. Standing between the four thousand Zulus and victory is the mission station at Rorke's Drift and about one hundred and forty British soldiers, some of whom are wounded. Commanding the military operation is the young Lieutenant John Chard (Stanley Baker, also co-producer of the film) with Lieutenant Gonville Bromhead (Michael Caine, in his first major film role). Against the unimaginable odds, the British troops - the B Company of the 24th Regiment of Foot, South Wales Borderers - manage, with exceptional courage and stoicism, to hold off the Zulu attacks until morning. The valour of the men defending Rourke's Drift resulted in the awarding of eleven Victoria Crosses. The roll of honour is recited by Richard Burton at the film's end.

Baker and Caine are very convincing in the two lead roles as Chard and Bromhead, the rival lieutenants from different social classes who come to respect and even like each other. Their first meeting emphasises the psychological as well as the physical distance between them. Chard, the Engineer Officer, in his shirt-sleeves, is up to his waist in water; Bromhead, the upper-class blue-blood, in his helmet and fine cloak, is on horseback, having just returned from hunting. However, as the battle progresses, this rivalry is forgotten as their prime concern is the job in hand. Their exchange when Chard is injured and Bromhead goes to his aid is telling. By the end of the film, as they stand together in the burnt-out ruins of the hospital, they are equals.

The incredibly virile Stanley Baker (one wants to say, "Fwhoar!" every time he appears on screen) co-produced the film because, like most Welshmen, he was extremely patriotic and wanted to publicise the bravery of the Welsh soldiers at Rorke's Drift. Michael Caine auditioned originally for the part of Hook but was offered instead the part of Bromhead as his looks were considered more suited to those of an upper-class officer than a Cockney private.

Good support is given by the other actors in the supporting roles. James Booth as Private Henry Hook is probably the most memorable character, portrayed (historically inaccurately) as the company ne'er-do-well, yet who wakes up to his duty at the moment of crisis and fights almost to the death. Jack Hawkins and Ulla Jacobssen are effective as the well-meaning but naive father-and-daughter missionaries, the Witts. The outstanding bravery and selflessness of the other (mainly) Welsh soldiers is brought out by all the actors in the subordinate roles. 

What I think is very admirable about 'Zulu' is its lack of jingoism. Far from it crowing about British supremacy over the natives, it portrays the bravery of the Zulus as equal to or even greater than that of the British. At the end of the battle, there is no great rejoicing; it was just a job which had to be done because they were there. In the ruins of the hospital, when Chard asks Bromhead how he feels, Bromhead replies, "Sick." Their dialogue continues: 

Bromhead: There's something else. I feel ashamed. Was that how it was for you? The first time?

Chard: First time? Do you think I could stand this butcher's yard more than once?

Bromhead: I didn't know. 

Chard: I told you. I came up here to build a bridge.

No more needs to be said.

Although the character names and events are factual, the film does sometimes sacrifice historical accuracy for dramatic effect. How much real rivalry there was between Chard and Bromhead is unclear - although it is true that Bromhead ceded command to Chard. Private Hook was not the thief and ne'er-do-well as played by James Booth. Colour Sergeant Bourne was a short man and quite unlike Nigel Green in appearance. Most of the Victoria Cross winners were English, not Welsh. And the film itself was shot not at Rorke's Drift but at a location some miles away.

Interestingly, neither Chard nor Bromhead lived to a great age. Both died in their forties, Chard of mouth cancer in 1897 and Bromhead of fever on active service a few years before. Neither ever married. Nevertheless, their names are immortalised in 'Zulu' - as are the deeds of the tremendously brave men, Welsh, English and Zulu, at Rorke's Drift on 22nd/23rd January 1879.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":37784,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"Not Rated","genre":["Drama","History","War"],"datePublished":"1964-06-10","keywords":"hopelessly outnumbered,zulu,british army,military tactics,anglo zulu war","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1889321753","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTk3MTRjYmEtMGRhYy00NmUxLWFhOWQtNDgwYzNmNTZmMjJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Outnumbered British soldiers do battle with Zulu warriors at Rorke's Drift."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0048939/","name":"Stanley Baker"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0370144/","name":"Jack Hawkins"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0414965/","name":"Ulla Jacobsson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0103340/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695667/","name":"John Prebble"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0256831/","name":"Cy Endfield"}],"duration":"PT2H18M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Phoenix, Oregon
Phoenix, Oregon
programme.desc: Phoenix, Oregon: Directed by Gary Lundgren. With James Le Gros, Jesse Borrego, Lisa Edelstein, Diedrich Bader. Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8586088/","name":"Phoenix, Oregon","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMDlhMGRlYzctNWYzOC00NmE3LWE3MWQtNDk4NmNiODUwMTcyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMzQxOTU3NjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two longtime friends battle mid-life crisis by opening a bowling alley/pizzeria in their small hometown.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt8586088/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"LilyWai"},"dateCreated":"2020-04-22","inLanguage":"English","name":"Genuine","reviewBody":"Loved this film, a little sweet snapshot of how droll the midlife grind can be when you don't have the life you thought you'd have. Great understated performance from James LeGros as Bobby, and the full cast of his friends & associates offer plenty of dramatic layers for his character to engage with. Jesse Borego as Carlos is a breath of fresh air to Bobby's downer moments & his passion for his craft is infectious. I appreciated the fumbled semi romantic thread between Bobby and Tanya too as too often in movies it's all packaged up so neatly the viewer is deprived of seeing the truth when it comes to 'just not the right time' connections. Oh and have to mention Kevin Corrigan's Al, nicely positioned in both character and storyline as Bobby's polar opposite nemesis. Highly recommend but one negative is I almost passed this by thanks to the insipid title. I get the 'Phoenix' connection in the storyline but come on, something a little more thoughtful would be cherry on the top.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":338,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy"],"datePublished":"2020-03-20","keywords":"battle","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer [EN]","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3567762969","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjZkZmZlM2YtYzgwZi00YTBiLTg2MmUtYWFhYjFjOWI3ODgzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001457/","name":"James Le Gros"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001963/","name":"Jesse Borrego"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0249046/","name":"Lisa Edelstein"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0324375/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1390437/","name":"Gary Lundgren"}],"duration":"PT1H48M"}</script><metacontent="
